Cost validation complete — projected $185.55/month vs $55-120 estimate. ⚠️ CRITICAL: email-monitor (*/5 min) costs $87/month alone. Recommended: reduce to */15 min for $99/month total. Full report: docs/COST-VALIDATION-REPORT.md

email-monitor changed to */15 min (was */5), git-autocommit changed to hourly (was */30) — projected savings $86.07/month. New monthly projection: $99.48 (within $55-120 budget). Updated: docs/COST-VALIDATION-REPORT.md, memory/cost-tracker.json

Created briefing feedback infrastructure: memory/briefing-feedback.json (rating schema), docs/BRIEFING-FEEDBACK.md (full docs with 1-5 scale, section names, voice capture patterns), updated automation/VOICE-TASK-CAPTURE.md (added briefing feedback detection patterns). Enables continuous improvement of morning briefings based on Michael's ratings.

Morning briefing cron updated with feedback loop integration. Added pre-assembly block: reads briefing-feedback.json, applies adjustments (skip_sections, include_less, include_more, custom_rules), detects low ratings (<3 avg), auto-adjusts sections with 3+ worst_section mentions. New job ID: 8847226f-f75f-41af-81e3-46a8b0abdbcf. Tomorrow's 7 AM briefing will be feedback-aware.

Created Opus usage tracking infrastructure: memory/opus-usage-log.json (escalation tracking schema with 8 categories), docs/OPUS-USAGE-PATTERNS.md (full documentation with decision framework, review cycles, auto-escalation rules), updated AGENTS.md (added Opus escalation tracking section), updated memory-consolidation cron to check opus-usage-log.json weekly and identify auto-escalation candidates (5+ entries in 4 weeks). New memory-consolidation job ID: b8d85740-c582-4940-bec0-a949125a26fe. Goal: After 4+ weeks of data, auto-escalate categories that consistently benefit from Opus.

FutureNTech automated video production pipeline documented in docs/FUTURENTECH-PIPELINE.md. 6-stage pipeline: (1) Form check cron (daily 8 AM, Haiku) monitors Google Form submissions, (2) Research stage (Sonnet, 15-30 min) evaluates artist fit, (3) Script writing (Sonnet, 30-45 min) creates 6-8 min video scripts, (4) Voice generation (Sonnet, after approval) uses ElevenLabs/sag, (5) Video production (Sonnet, 20-40 min) uses ffmpeg, (6) Upload (Haiku, after approval) uses youtube-upload. 2 approval gates: script approval and final video review. Estimated ~2 hours automated work + 15-25 min human approval per video. Cost: ~$0.62/video. Ready for implementation (Build 5.5b).

Created futurentech-form-check cron job (ID: 6b047a05-dad3-45fd-b37d-d4ef985fd8c3). Schedule: daily 8 AM, Haiku model. Monitors Google Form submissions (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1hD5OPvNMbyYufqqB_fcXCieRWgspzK-ZVl-HxJDTVaw), checks against processed-submissions.json for new artists, creates research tasks in tasks/queue.json with metadata (artist_name, music_links, social_links, email). Silent if no new submissions. Total active cron jobs: 11.

Task-worker cron updated with full FutureNTech pipeline handling (new ID: c74ba6a0-4724-4502-a6cc-9de41d392437). Added 5 FutureNTech action types: (1) research-artist - evaluates fit, writes research notes, creates script task if good fit, (2) write-script - creates 6-8 min video script, blocks for approval, alerts Michael, (3) generate-voice - uses sag CLI + voice Rt1MCyQ54DxjUUsampFD after approval, (4) produce-video - ffmpeg video production + thumbnail generation, blocks for final review, (5) upload-video - youtube-upload after approval, sends confirmation + artist thank-you email. All tasks log to work-log with category 'futurentech'. Task-worker now handles general tasks + full FutureNTech pipeline end-to-end.
